intro: Odontarrhena dubertretii, commonly known as the Madagascar dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has adapted to the island's unique climate. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Odontarrhena dubertretii is of interest to botanists due to its endemic status and potential medicinal properties.
